text: Paranthropus boisei was originally called Zinjanthropus boisei and then Australopithecus boisei until recently. It was an australopithecine, the largest of the Paranthropus species. It lived from about 2.6 until about 1.2 million years ago during the Pliocene and Pleistocene epochs in Eastern Africa. It was 4' 6" tall for a male and 4' 1" for a female.Paranthropus boisei topics. Smithsonian National Museum of Natural History. Retrieved 11 July 2012. == References == category:Australopithecines
title: Paranthropus boisei
